CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in CH 3 CN using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode. Electrochemical measurements for small molecule 4b were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in distilled CH 2 Cl 2 using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) measurements were performed on Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer ( model DTG-60 ) under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 10 °C min -1 .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| CH 3 CN (acetonitrile) |
| glassy-carbon |
| platinum - wire |
| Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode |
| distilled CH 2 Cl 2 (dichloromethane) |
| Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer (model DTG-60) |
| nitrogen |

The "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph are: tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate, CH 3 CN (acetonitrile), glassy-carbon, platinum - wire, Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode, distilled CH 2 Cl 2 (dichloromethane), Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer (model DTG-60), and nitrogen.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| CH 3 CN (acetonitrile) |
| glassy-carbon |
| platinum - wire |
| Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode |
| distilled CH 2 Cl 2 (dichloromethane) |
| nitrogen |

After reviewing the entities, I have removed "Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer (model DTG-60)" as it is not a material but a device used for measurements. The remaining entities are all materials and are presented in the table above.

Electrochemical measurements for small molecule 4b were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in distilled CH 2 Cl 2 using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode. PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in CH 3 CN using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode. Electrochemical measurements for small molecule 4b were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in distilled CH 2 Cl 2 using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) measurements were performed on Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer ( model DTG-60 ) under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 10 °C min -1 .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.1 M |
| CH 3 CN |
| distilled CH 2 Cl 2 |
| 10 °C min -1 |

Explanation:

- "0.1 M" is a material property value in the first sentence, representing the molarity of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate.
- "CH 3 CN" is a material property value in the first sentence, representing the solvent acetonitrile.
- "distilled CH 2 Cl 2" is a material property value in the second sentence, representing the solvent dichloromethane.
- "10 °C min -1" is a material property value in the third sentence, representing the heating rate for thermogravimetric analysis.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.1 M |
| CH 3 CN |
| distilled CH 2 Cl 2 |

Explanation:

- "0.1 M" is a material property value in the first sentence, representing the molarity of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate.
- "CH 3 CN" is a material property value in the first sentence, representing the solvent acetonitrile.
- "distilled CH 2 Cl 2" is a material property value in the second sentence, representing the solvent dichloromethane.

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

- "Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6" and "Electrochemical measurements for small molecule 4b" are descriptions of the measurements being performed, not material property values.
- "Nitrogen" is mentioned as the atmosphere in which the measurements are being carried out, but it is not a material property value.
- "A computer-controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation", "a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films", "a platinum-wire auxiliary electrode", and "an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode" are descriptions of the equipment used for the electrochemical measurements, not material property values.
- "Shimadzu thermogravimetric analyzer (model DTG-60)" and "a nitrogen flow" are descriptions of the equipment used for the thermogravimetric analysis, not material property values.
